oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Lt. James A. Wallace to "Emma"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This multi-page letter from Lt. James A. Wallace was written from a "Camp of Instruction" in Knoxville, Tenn. It begins on April 15, 1863 and concludes on April 24, 1863. Wallace is writing to "Emma" of their past correspondence and the war. He writes "Signes indicate a bloody engagement in Middle Tenn. Soon the spring Campaign is about opening. I think we have near reached the crisis of the war. The last greate struggle is about to be made." He also writes of the funeral of Gen. Daniel Smith Donelson.
